entry.title: What's the best way to call or use my custom Data Provider Class on my v4 OData service?
entry.content:
Since v4 Odata service uses standard class, what's the best approach on calling or using the custom model for data provider class?

Context: My Odata service is connected to custom fiori app. Also, i have created a custom class that contains custom logic. My behavior definition also calls the custom class that I've had created.

Objective: When an action button is used/pressed, I would like to call the class ZCL_QM_TEST which I would like to call the specific action which is get_entity.

Behavior definition code:

managed implementation in class ZCL_TEST unique;
strict ( 2 );

define behavior for Z_TEST_CDS
persistent table qals
lock master
authorization master ( instance )

{
   create;
   update;
   delete;
   field( mandatory ) InpsectionLot;

   action get_entity result [0..*] $self;
}

entry.title: Is there a way to get the list of all instructors through API ?
entry.content: Is there a way to get the list of all instructors through ODATA API ?

entry.title: How to update multiple entities in a single OData $batch request.
entry.content:
• I am sending one  $batch request with multipart/mixed format.

  • Inside, you created one changeset with 3 PATCH requests.

  • SAP will execute all 3 updates together.

  • If one fails (e.g. invalid IBAN), the whole changeset is rolled back.

 

 

--batch_001
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=changeset_001

--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartner('XXXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"BusinessPartnerCategory": "X",
"BusinessPartnerGrouping": "XXXX"
}
--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartnerAddress(BusinessPartner='XXXX',AddressID='XXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"CityName": "Dubai",
"PostalCode": "00000"
}
--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartnerBank(BusinessPartner='XXXX',BankIdentification='XXXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"BankName": "XXXXXXXXX",
"IBAN": "XXXXXXXXXXX"
}

--changeset_001--
--batch_001--

What is the proper way to unpublish the service binding in able to delete it without issues?

entry.title: Problem with oData Batch Update of SalesOrderItem
entry.content:
Hi 

I have looked at the following article related to the update of SalesOrderItem
ETag Handling | SAP Help Portal

It says

"The Etag handling feature is implemented on the A_SalesOrder node with the LastChangeDateTime property. If you want to use ETag handling for other entities (for example, A_SalesOrderItem), proceed as follows:

  1. Perform a GET operation to retrieve the content for the LastChangeDateTime property.

  2. Create a $batch request containing one changeset.

  3. As first operation of the changeset, include a PATCH A_SalesOrder with the LastChangeDateTime property. Provide the LastChangeDateTime content also in the request header in the If-Match field.

  4. As second operation of the changeset, include the desired payload (for example, POST A_SalesOrderItem or PATCH A_SalesOrderItem) with the relevant data"

With this in information I created the following XML with a view to update a single line initially.

<batchParts>
  <batchChangeSet>
    <batchChangeSetPart>
      <method>PATCH</method>
      <headers>
        <headerName>If-Match</headerName>
        <headerValue>W/"datetimeoffset'2025-09-10T07%3A27%3A59.4526150Z'"</headerValue>
      </headers>
      <A_SalesOrder>
        <A_SalesOrderType>
          <LastChangeDateTime>2025-09-10T07:27:59.452</LastChangeDateTime>
        </A_SalesOrderType>
      </A_SalesOrder>
    </batchChangeSetPart>
    <batchChangeSetPart>
      <method>PATCH</method>
      <A_SalesOrderItem>
        <A_SalesOrderItemType>
          <SalesOrder>1017493</SalesOrder>
          <SalesOrderItem>10</SalesOrderItem>
          <RequestedQuantity>26.2</RequestedQuantity>
          <RequestedQuantityUnit>TO</RequestedQuantityUnit>
        </A_SalesOrderItemType>
      </A_SalesOrderItem>
    </batchChangeSetPart>
  </batchChangeSet>
</batchParts>

After executing this using the following odata

I get the following error 

com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Cannot invoke "String.equalsIgnoreCase(String)" because the return value of "java.util.Map$Entry.getKey()" is null, cause: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "String.equalsIgnoreCase(String)" because the return value of "java.util.Map$Entry.getKey()" is null

 

Please can someone explain what the issue is with the

entry.title: LMS Expert! Please guide - Scheduled offerings Question
entry.content: I am working on retrieving all scheduled offerings from SF LMS. I found the following API, but it requires an instructorID as input: /learning/odatav4/public/admin/scheduledoffering-service/v1/ScheduledToTeachClasses?$filter=sttcCriteria/fromDate eq 1756473000000 and sttcCriteria/toDate eq 1856498200000 and sttcCriteria/instructorID eq 'instructorID' &expand=segments($select=*)&$select=* The challenge is that to get all scheduled offerings, I would need to call this API for every instructorID. However, I haven’t been able to find any API that provides a list of instructorIDs. Has anyone come across a way to retrieve instructorIDs, or is there an alternative approach to get all scheduled offerings without filtering by instructorID?

entry.content:

      "type": "SFOData.PerPerson"

    "createdDateTime": "/Date(1305980630000+0000)/",
    "createdOn": "/Date(1305980630000)/",
    "countryOfBirth": null,
    "placeOfBirth": null,
    "lastModifiedBy": "v4admin",
    "dateOfBirth": null,
    "customString2": null,
    "perPersonUuid": "*************",

      }

    "personalInfoNav": {
      "results": []
    },

 

Hi,

I have a permission role set up in SAP SuccessFactors with following rules:

  • Employee central HRIS Odata permission is given to the user.
  • The granted user is given to a group containing a single user
  • The target population is selected as All employees
  • The effective dated entities [Personal Information] and employee data [Biographical information] is selected

Although I am getting a 200-response code when calling the endpoint https://{companyURL}/odata/v2/PerPerson({userID}),

The personalInfoNav is null.

entry.title: What end-to-end testing tools are best for SAP BTP (BAS) applications with CDS views and SAPUI5?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) projects deployed on SAP BTP that use CDS views as the data model and SAPUI5 for the front end.

I would like to implement end-to-end testing for these applications. I am familiar with general-purpose tools like Playwright or WebdriverIO, but I am not sure if they are the best fit when testing applications in the SAP ecosystem (especially those with CDS/OData services and SAPUI5).

  • Has anyone successfully used Playwright or WebdriverIO for BAS/SAPUI5 projects?

  • Are there recommended frameworks or libraries specifically designed for UI5 applications?

  • What are the best practices for handling such tests?

  • Any tutorials, examples, or community resources you could share?

Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: SAP CPI: Retrieve Iflow unique id(reg_id) via IFlow (workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages)
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

There is an internal (unofficial) API for SAP CPI artifacts. 

 

https://<your-host>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/1.0/workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages('<your-package>')/Artifacts?&$format=json

In comparison to the official API, it for packages it will give you an internal ID of an Iflow (reg_id). 
In browser, once one is logged into CPI, entering the URL will respond with JSON data back. 
But how to execute that in an automated Iflow?
I already tried to create OAuth2 (Code) credentials, read the Token via script and authenticate via Header. It did not work. 
Any hint, example is more than welcome.

thank you & kind regards | Simon

entry.title: F0797 App Extension OData Service - Manage Billing Docs.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have successfully created a Fiori Extension Project in BAS for Fiori App F0797: Manage Billing Documents. I added a new custom action/button to the worklistview. The new button will update the billing date for the records selected in the worklist. In my app preview, the button is displayed correctly, and the popup is also working as expected and provided the user with the option to select the new billing date.

How to tie this to the backend SAP system for processing?
The OData project in SEGW is SD_CUSTOMER_INVOICES_MANAGE. My question is, do I need to create a copy of this project and add my custom logic in the DPC_EXT class?  Or, am I able to create a new service entirely and add it to my Extension project in BAS? The new service would only be enabled for my custom action/button. What is the preferred approach when extending Fiori Apps which are UI5 based?

Attached are my worklist custom controller. 

Edit-----*

I figured out a solution for this and it is working as expected.

Br,
Jared

entry.title: S/4HANA API for A_JournalEntryItemBasic changes order of results if $select fields
entry.content:
When I query using the REST API the A_JournalEntryItemBasic resource of the API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV service, if I change the list of fields to retrieve, using the $select parameter, then the order of the results change. Even if I add an $orderby !

For example, I expect that a GET request to this two URLs return the same record (same ID, same URI) but represented with a different set of fields. Because I'm passing `$top=1` so only the first result should be returned:

  1. GET https://sandbox.api.sap.com//s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic?%24top=1&%24select=ID%2CLedger%2CLedgerName%2CSourceLedger%2CLedg
    erFiscalYear%2CControllingArea%2CControllingAreaName%2CCompanyCode%2CCompanyCodeName%2CGLAccount%2CGLAccountName&%24orderby=Ledger
  2. GET https://sandbox.api.sap.com//s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic?%24top=1&%24select=WBSElement%2CWBSElementDescription%2CPartnerCo
    mpanyCode%2CPartnerCompanyCodeName%2CCostCtrActivityType%2CCostCtrActivityTypeName%2COrderID%2CLedger&%24orderby=Ledger

But two different URIs are returned. First:

{'__metadata': {'id': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001')",
  'uri': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001')",
  'type': 'API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV.A_JournalEntryItemBasicType'},
 'ID': '.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001',
 'Ledger': '0C',
 'LedgerName': 'Management Accounting',
 'SourceLedger': '0L',
 'LedgerFiscalYear': '2018',
 'ControllingArea': 'A000',
 'ControllingAreaName': 'Controlling Area A000',
 'CompanyCode': '1010',
 'CompanyCodeName': 'BestRun DE',
 'GLAccount': '1',
 'GLAccountName': 'Paybls Domestic'}

And second:

{'__metadata': {'id': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.71~.73~.75~.77~')",
  'uri': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.71~.73~.75~.77~')",
  'type': 'API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV.A_JournalEntryItemBasicType'},
 'Ledger': '0C',
 'WBSElement': '',
 'WBSElementDescription': '',
 'PartnerCompanyCode': '',
 'PartnerCompanyCodeName': '',
 'CostCtrActivityType': '',
 'CostCtrActivityTypeName': '',
 'OrderID': ''}

The OData specification says:

Select System Query Option ($select): A data service URI with a $select System Query Option identifies the same set of entities as a URI without a $select query option; however, the presence of a $select query option specifies that a response from the data service SHOULD return a subset, as identified by the value of the $select query option, of the properties that would have been returned had the URI not included a $select query option.

What am I missing?

 

UPDATE:
Apparently what I take as a row ID is actually a GENERATED_ID : a special property name used in OData services to uniquely identify aggregated or grouped data records. When you request aggregated data in an OData service, a GENERATED_ID property is automatically created for each resulting group. This ID serves as a unique key for that aggregated record, allowing you to request the same aggregated data again by referencing this ID.

So now, I don't know how to identify rows and thus how to match two rows from different queries. Can I rely on the order of the results?

entry.title: Consuming two ODatas from different destinations
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m facing an auth/routing issue after deploying a Fiori/UI5 app to BTP CF. Locally everything works: calls to an OData V2 service must go through a Destination named DEST (BasicAuthentication with a technical user), while other OData calls go through s4destination (xsuaa).

Symptom (only after deploy): calls sometimes reach the backend as my own user instead of the technical user from DEST — or the opposite (all calls go as the technical user), even when I’m calling the “DEST” dataSource.

This is my destination configuration:

 

The OData I'm trying to call is FAC_GL_DOCUMENT_POST_SRV. In deploy it goes through the s4destrt destination, which is the one I use for the others OData calls. This is my xd-app.json: 

  {
    "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
    "authenticationMethod": "route",
    "logout": {
      "logoutEndpoint": "/do/logout",
      "logoutPage": "/"
    },
    "sessionTimeout": 60,
    "routes": [
      {
        "source": "^/DEST/(.*)$",
        "target": "$1",
        "destination": "DEST",
        "authenticationType": "none",
        "csrfProtection": false
      },
      {
        "source": "^/s4destination/(.*)$",
        "target": "$1",
        "destination": "s4destination",
        "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
        "csrfProtection": false
      },      
      {
        "source": "^/resources/(.*)$",
        "target": "/resources/$1",
        "authenticationType": "none",
        "destination": "ui5"
      },
      {
        "source": "^/test-resources/(.*)$",
        "target": "/test-resources/$1",
        "authenticationType": "none",
        "destination": "ui5"
      },
      {
        "source": "^(.*)$",
        "target": "$1",
        "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
        "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
      }
    ]
  }
 
This is my manifest: 
"dataSources": {
"mainService": {
"uri": "s4destination/sap/opu/odata4/sap/odata1/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "4.0" }
},
"FAC_GL_DOCUMENT_POST_SRV": {
"uri": "DEST/sap/opu/odata/sap/FAC_GL_DOCUMENT_POST_SRV/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "2.0" }
}
}
 
Can you help me solve this issue? Thanks!

entry.title: CPI: OData v2 PATCH request includes key in body
entry.content:
I'm creating an iflow using the OData v2 adapter to connect to S/4HANA 2023 FPS02 (on-premise) using the SalesOrder (A2X) API package. The iflow needs to update a Sales Order with a delivery block.

For this I'm using a PATCH request. This request is automatically configured through the wizard fetching the metadata from the S/4HANA server:

The payload data is set via a message mapping taking the values from exchange properties, being mapped to the XSD generated from the above PATCH configuration:

Given that 'SalesOrder' is the key field it is marked as mandatory in the EDMX and a value is required.

The problem I'm facing is that the query going to S/4HANA correctly has the key field in the url, but also (incorrectly) in the body:

request:
PATCH /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/A_SalesOrder(SalesOrder='123')

body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<A_SalesOrder>
  <A_SalesOrderType>
    <SalesOrder>123</SalesOrder>
    <DeliveryBlockReason>50</DeliveryBlockReason>
  </A_SalesOrderType>
</A_SalesOrder>

To which S/4HANA responds: "Key field SALESORDER must not be changed.". This error is correct according to the OData specification mentioning that key fields should not be part of the body. This is also confirmed by the API docs: "You must always provide all key fields in the URL to identify the entity." A simple test case without that field in the body goes through fine.

I know that I can easily get around this by using custom logic etc, but I'm looking for a clean, out-of-the-box solution.

Is there a specific configuration in the OData v2 adapter to make it remove key fields from the body for patch calls? Removing the field from the 'Fields' setting does not make a difference.

entry.title: HTTP failed: INTERNAL_ERROR in SAP Gateway Client for OData Service
entry.content:

I'm testing an OData service  in the SAP Gateway Client with the Request URI /sap/opu/odata/sap/.../$format=xml using a GET method. I’m encountering an "HTTP failed: INTERNAL_ERROR" message. The Error Log tab shows no additional details yet.

Could you please help me understand how to resolve this INTERNAL_ERROR?  is this a configuration issue or a system problem?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
Ashok
